comments:
After about 5-10 min. of debugging any Java program, the Variables view stops 
displaying the variable data. The tree structure information is still 
displayed and you can expand or collapse nodes but no data is displayed. Once 
this happens, the only remedy is to restart Eclipse. Closing and restarting 
the Variables view is not sufficient.

I am running on a dual processor 933Mhz machine with 1GB of memory and 512MB 
assigned to Eclipse.

I am running Windows XP with service pack 1.

I am running Sun JDK 1.4.1_02.

I am running Eclipse build I20030917.

If you have difinitive steps to reproduce the problem - it would be handy. As 
well, is there anything in you ".log" file?

It happens when stepping through the program but the specifics vary widely. It 
seems that I canot go more than about 10 min. of debugging within a single 
launch without this happening.

I am attaching my log file which starts late yesterday. The entries in it may 
be symptomatic of more than one problem (I have filed 3 bug reports this 
morning for different problems).
